acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 72 hours ErC50=3.4mg/L of the algae (Selenastrum) (MOE Eco-Toxicity Tests of Chemicals, 2003).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >3,160mg/kg, together with the absence of mortality (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1994)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification cannot be determined, though the available rat inhalation study reported the LC50 value of >2.1mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1994)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of >5,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1994)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no evidence of treatment-related incidence of tumor formation observed in rat and mouse carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1994)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 2 and the bio-accumulation potential was low (log Kow=3.43(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), it was classified into Category 2.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 156.2degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)).

explosives.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data on the kick-off temperature and decomposition energy, though being an acetylene compound containing a triple bond, with its oxygen budget calculated at -178.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro studies (reverse mutation tests, chromosome aberration tests and UDS tests) and chromosome aberration tests on rat and mouse bone marrow cells in vivo (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1994)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine and oxygen (but not fluorine), with the chlorine and oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Considered non-pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures since the substance is stable to heat (up to 229.1degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on parental reproduction and offspring development observed in rat 2-generation reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1994)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Stable to heat (up to 229.1degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data , though containing a triple bond and chemical groups with self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of conjunctival effects with a Draize score of <=1, which cleared up within 4 days, observed in rabbit eye irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1994)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of irritant effects with a Draize score of <=1, which were fully reversed within 72 hours, observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1994)).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: No skin sensitizing potential was found in guinea pig sensitization tests employing the Buehler and Maximization methods (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1993, 1998)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, kidney)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including hyperpigmentation/Glisson capsule abnormalities/cell abnormalities of the liver, degeneration of renal tubular epithelium/glomerular atrophy (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1994)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
